title: Sidebar header hamburger icon and collapsible LeftSidebar navigation

requirements.summary: Add a hamburger icon immediately left of the “Fourleaf” brand text inside the LeftSidebar header row with consistent padding/alignment.
acceptanceCriteria: In the LeftSidebar top header block, a hamburger icon appears directly to the left of the “Fourleaf” text (not above or below it).
The hamburger icon and the brand text are vertically aligned and visually centered within the header row.
Padding/margins remain consistent with the existing header container styling (no crowding or overlap).

file_operations.description: Update the sidebar header container to render a left-aligned hamburger toggle button, followed by the Fourleaf logo mark and a separate “Fourleaf” text node so the icon sits immediately left of the brand text; keep existing header padding and row alignment. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Optionally extend FourleafBrand with a small helper variant (or exported sub-render) that allows LeftSidebar to compose logo mark and brand text separately without duplicating SVG markup, enabling precise hamburger-to-text positioning. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Style the hamburger icon as three thick rounded green bars matching the Fourleaf green accent and ensure it renders crisply at ~24px.
acceptanceCriteria: The icon is rendered as exactly three horizontal bars.
Bars are visually thick and have rounded ends.
Icon color matches the green used in the existing Fourleaf logo elements.
Icon remains crisp at typical sizes (e.g., ~24px).

file_operations.description: Add/replace the hamburger icon SVG as three thick horizontal bars with rounded ends in the same vibrant green accent used by the Fourleaf logo (e.g., #22c55e), sized to render crisply at 24x24. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Use the generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/hamburger-menu.dim_24x24.svg for the new sidebar-header hamburger button; ensure sizing and alignment keep it visually prominent and crisp. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Make the sidebar-header hamburger button toggle LeftSidebar between expanded and collapsed states without changing nav order/routes or dark styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the hamburger icon toggles between an expanded and collapsed sidebar state.
Navigation items remain present and in the same order; collapsing only changes the sidebar presentation (e.g., width and/or label visibility), not the routes.
Collapsed state remains usable (icons still visible/clickable; labels may be hidden or minimized).
The sidebar retains the existing dark styling (background, card translucency, borders) in both states.

file_operations.description: Introduce a desktop-capable collapsed/expanded state for LeftSidebar driven by the new hamburger button: collapse reduces sidebar width and hides/minimizes nav labels while keeping icons and click targets intact; preserve nav item order and existing dark card/translucent styling in both states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust layout wiring as needed so the sidebar’s new collapse behavior does not conflict with the existing mobile drawer open/close behavior; keep routes and destinations unchanged and ensure the app header remains consistent with the dark aesthetic. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add smooth expand/collapse animation with reduced-motion support and accessible ARIA/keyboard behavior on the hamburger toggle.
acceptanceCriteria: Expand/collapse animates smoothly (e.g., width/opacity) without jarring layout jumps.
Animation respects reduced-motion preferences (no/instant transition when reduced motion is enabled).
Hamburger toggle button includes clear ARIA labeling (English) and reflects state via aria-expanded.
Keyboard interaction works (toggle is focusable and activates via Enter/Space).

file_operations.description: Add Tailwind-based transitions for sidebar width and label opacity/visibility, including motion-reduce fallbacks; implement the hamburger as a real button (using existing Button) with aria-label, aria-expanded reflecting expanded state, and keyboard activation via native button semantics. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

If needed for consistency with existing motion patterns, add a small utility or ensure existing motion-reduce conventions apply cleanly to the sidebar collapse transition (without introducing new global stylesheet paths). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
